title: Lane Education Service District (Lane ESD) — Role & Springfield Relationship

sources.label: Lane ESD
sources.title: Lane ESD Homepage
sources.summary: Lane Education Service District's main website, serving all 16 school districts in Lane County with special education, technology, and school improvement services.

sources.label: External
sources.title: Lane ESD Local Service Plan — Springfield Board Review
sources.summary: Coverage of Lane ESD's presentation of its streamlined 11-page Local Service Plan to the Springfield board, highlighting the funding mix and menu/custom service model.

takeaways: ESDs are regional service agencies that provide specialized services to school districts — they are not supervisory over local boards.
Lane ESD serves all 16 districts in Lane County, including Springfield SD 19.
Springfield's board must review and approve Lane ESD's Local Service Plan, which defines the services the district will receive.
The ESD funding model blends state funding, federal grants, and local contracts — districts choose from menu and custom service options.

knowledgeCheck.question: Lane ESD has supervisory authority over Springfield SD 19's board decisions.
knowledgeCheck.explanation: ESDs are service agencies, not supervisory bodies. They provide specialized services (like special education and technology) but do not have authority over local board decisions.

knowledgeCheck.question: How many school districts does Lane ESD serve?
knowledgeCheck.explanation: Lane ESD serves all 16 school districts in Lane County, Oregon, providing services including special education, technology, school improvement, and administrative support.
